title: Figma's 8 Essential Tips Empower Designers to Craft Responsive Branded Templates in Buzz

paragraphs.content: Figma's official blog outlines eight practical tips for designers building branded templates in Figma Buzz, emphasizing responsive structures that enable non-designers to create on-brand assets like social posts and event materials. Key recommendations include using auto layout to maintain spacing as content changes and separating text layers for each unique input to support bulk creation via CSV or XLSX imports. These guidelines ensure templates adapt flexibly without breaking formatting or alignment.

paragraphs.content: Component variants allow controlled customizations such as logo placements or CTA states, connecting templates to existing design systems for consistency. Locking brand-critical elements like logos prevents unintended edits, while descriptive layer naming like "Event Title" guides users effectively. Figma Buzz's focused editing mode further streamlines workflows by limiting changes to designated fields.

sections.title: Auto Layout and Layer Separation Drive Template Flexibility

paragraphs.content: Auto layout serves as the backbone of responsive templates, automatically adjusting elements like buttons and text boxes to prevent misalignment from varying content lengths. Designers must separate text layers by font style, weight, or purpose to ensure Bulk Create functionality maps data reliably without formatting issues. Renaming layers descriptively, such as "CTA Button Text," alongside example content like "Date of Event (e.g. July 10, 2025)," clarifies expectations for editors.

paragraphs.content: Publishing involves testing templates with realistic content to verify behavior under swaps or resizes, catching issues like text overlap early. Clear file titles and logical row groupings enhance discoverability in Buzz's template picker. These practices balance rigidity with usability, allowing marketers to generate assets efficiently.

sections.title: Component Variants and Locking Strategies Ensure Brand Integrity

paragraphs.content: Component sets from Figma Design enable variant swaps for layouts or illustrations, reducing the need for multiple templates while limiting exposure to manual edits. Locking non-editable elements like backgrounds or logos creates guidelines visible as pink outlines and lock icons in Buzz. Users can still update unlocked fields via the Edit Content panel, maintaining guardrails without blocking flexibility.

paragraphs.content: Best practices urge strategic locking focused on brand essentials, paired with comprehensive template sets for campaigns across platforms. Forward updates in Buzz, including plugin access and video trimming, expand template capabilities for motion assets and data connections. This evolution positions Buzz as a central hub for scalable, on-brand production.
